Description: Fragment of Attic pottery black-figured closed vase. Inside reserved; outside, part of a chariot team to right; remaining: the mane of the left trace horse, the neck in added white, and the red mane of the left pole horse, possible traces of the withers of the right pole horse, and part of the back, neck, red mane and harness (reins, red breast-band and a decorative band) of the right trace horse; traces of added white at the left break, may be part of a standing figure on the far side of the team.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg IV / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität (p.49 pl. 165.11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0902)
